reproduction.reason: Bug appears to be fixed in current CIRCT/LLVM-22 toolchain
reproduction.reproduction_command: export PATH=/opt/llvm-22/bin:$PATH && circt-verilog --ir-hw /tmp/test_reproduce.sv | arcilator | opt -O0 | llc -O0 --filetype=obj -o /tmp/test_reproduce.o

original_crash.error_signature: state type must have a known bit width; got '!llhd.ref<i1>'
original_crash.description: arcilator fails when processing inout ports with !llhd.ref<i1> type in state lowering phase

execution_result.key_error_phrase: state type must have a known bit width

notes: The test case executed without errors with current CIRCT toolchain. The original crash signature 'state type must have a known bit width; got "!llhd.ref<i1>"' was not reproduced. This suggests the bug may have been fixed in a newer version of CIRCT or through LLVM-22 integration.
